channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jacob Kiplimo sets new half marathon record, finishes in under 57 minutes
item.description: Kiplimo ran with a vengeance in Barcelona on Sunday — beating the previous fastest half marathon time by a whole 48 seconds.
item.content:encoded:
Kiplimo ran with a vengeance in Barcelona on Sunday — beating the previous fastest half marathon time by a whole 48 seconds.

(Image credit: Lorena Sopena)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Government Accountability official says fraud does exist, but it's not widespread
item.description: Government accountability officer says fraud is committed by "all walks of life" including "insider threats," but must be proven in court
item.content:encoded:
Government accountability officer says fraud is committed by "all walks of life" including "insider threats," but must be proven in court

(Image credit: Alex Brandon/AP)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Deadly storms sweep through the South, leaving at least 9 fatalities
item.description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said all of the state's 120 counties were impacted by the storm. "The biggest challenge of this event is it's everywhere."
item.content:encoded:
Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said all of the state's 120 counties were impacted by the storm. "The biggest challenge of this event is it's everywhere."

(Image credit: Clarksville Fire Rescue)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Congo says Rwanda-backed rebels occupy a 2nd major city in its mineral-rich east
item.description: Rwanda-backed rebels reached the center of east Congo's second largest city, Bukavu, on Sunday morning in an unprecedented expansion of their reach in their yearslong fighting.
item.content:encoded:
Rwanda-backed rebels reached the center of east Congo's second largest city, Bukavu, on Sunday morning in an unprecedented expansion of their reach in their yearslong fighting.

(Image credit: Janvier Barhahiga)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Protests are set to take place on Presidents Day. Here's why
item.description: Protests against the Trump administration's actions are planned for Presidents Day. Organizers say they are responding to "the anti-democratic and illegal actions of the Trump administration."
item.content:encoded:
Protests against the Trump administration's actions are planned for Presidents Day. Organizers say they are responding to "the anti-democratic and illegal actions of the Trump administration."

(Image credit: Fred Greaves)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: January 6th ... the board game?
item.description: Fight for America! is a new art installation about democracy that invites audiences to play a war game — battling over the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.
item.content:encoded:
Fight for America! is a new art installation about democracy that invites audiences to play a war game — battling over the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

(Image credit: J. Elon Goodman)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Vanasco

item.title: Fans in Montreal loudly boo U.S. anthem prior to Americans' 4 Nations game vs. Canada
item.description: It's the second time "The Star-Spangled Banner" drew that reaction in two games the United States has played at the NHL-run international tournament.
item.content:encoded:
It's the second time "The Star-Spangled Banner" drew that reaction in two games the United States has played at the NHL-run international tournament.

(Image credit: Christinne Muschi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 18 people are dead after a stampede at New Delhi railway station in India
item.description: Many of the victims were Hindu pilgrims who were traveling to the Maha Kumbh festival in northern India. Thousands of people were gathered at the New Delhi railway station waiting to board a train.
item.content:encoded:
Many of the victims were Hindu pilgrims who were traveling to the Maha Kumbh festival in northern India. Thousands of people were gathered at the New Delhi railway station waiting to board a train.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What's it like to report from the Panama Canal?
item.description: A team from NPR's All Things Considered went to Panama to report on the canal there, which has gained attention in recent months due to President Trump's comments about the U.S. taking control of it.
item.content:encoded: A team from NPR's All Things Considered went to Panama to report on the canal there, which has gained attention in recent months due to President Trump's comments about the U.S. taking control of it.
item.dc:creator: Noah Caldwell

item.title: Amazon workers vote against unionizing a North Carolina warehouse
item.description: Workers voted against joining a grassroots union called Carolina Amazonians United for Solidarity and Empowerment, or CAUSE.
item.content:encoded:
Workers voted against joining a grassroots union called Carolina Amazonians United for Solidarity and Empowerment, or CAUSE.

(Image credit: Scott Sharpe)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
